text.0: men come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body.
text.1: both thy two regions of the earth o viṣṇu we know thou god knowest the highest also.
text.2: none who is born or being born god viṣṇu hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur.
text.3: the vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported and fixed earths eastern pinnacle securely.
text.4: rich in sweet food be ye and rich in milchkine with fertile pastures fain to do men service.
text.5: both these worlds viṣṇu hast thou stayed asunder and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.
text.6: ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating sūrya dawn and agni.
text.7: o heroes ye have conquered in your battles even the bulljawed dāsas wiles and magic.
text.8: ye have destroyed thou indra and thou viṣṇu Śambaras nineandninety fenced castles.
text.9: ye twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal varcin.
text.10: this is the lofty hymn of praise exalting the lords of mighty stride the strong and lofty.
text.11: i laud you in the solemn synods viṣṇu pour ye food on us in our camps o indra.
text.12: o viṣṇu unto thee my lips cry vaṣaṭ let this mine offering sipivista please thee.
text.13: may these my songs of eulogy exalt thee preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
